summary.para: This indicates whether an optional capability is supported by the D3D device.

param.name: feature
param.para: The feature to query support for.

param.name: featureSupportData
param.para: A structure indicating information about how or if the feature is supported.

param.name: featureSupportDataSize
param.para: The size of the featureSupportData parameter.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

summary.para: This creates a blend transform that can be inserted into a transform graph.

param.name: numInputs
param.para: The number of inputs to the blend transform.

param.name: blendDescription
param.para: Describes the blend transform that is to be created.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

summary.para: Creates a transform that extends its input infinitely in every direction based on the passed in extend mode.

param.name: extendModeX
param.para: The extend mode in the X-axis direction.

param.name: extendModeY
param.para: The extend mode in the Y-axis direction.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

summary.para: Creates and returns a bounds adjustment transform.

param.name: outputRectangle
param.para: The initial output rectangle for the bounds adjustment transform.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

remarks.para: A support transform can be used for two different reasons.

item.description: To indicate that a region of its input image is already transparent black. This can increase efficiency for rendering bitmaps. Note If the indicated region does NOT contain only transparent black pixels, then rendering results are undefined.
To increase the size of the input image. The expanded area will be treated as transparent black

summary.para: Creates a color context from a color space.
If the color space is Custom, the context is initialized from the profile and profileSize parameters.
If the color space is not Custom, the context is initialized with the profile bytes associated with the color space. The profile and profileSize parameters are ignored.

param.name: space
param.para: The space of color context to create.

param.name: profile
param.para: A buffer containing the ICC profile bytes used to initialize the color context when space is . For other types, the parameter is ignored and should be set to NULL.

param.name: profileSize
param.para: The size in bytes of Profile.

param.name: colorContext
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a new color context object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid value was passed to the method.

summary.para: Creates a color context by loading it from the specified filename. The profile bytes are the contents of the file specified by filename.

param.name: filename
param.para: The path to the file containing the profile bytes to initialize the color context with.

param.name: colorContext
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a new color context.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid value was passed to the method.

summary.para: Creates a color context from an . The space of the resulting context varies, see Remarks for more info.

param.name: wicColorContext
param.para: The used to initialize the color context.

param.name: colorContext
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a new color context.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid value was passed to the method.

remarks.para: The new color context can be used in to initialize the color context of a created bitmap. The model field of the profile header is inspected to determine whether this profile is sRGB or scRGB and the color space is updated respectively. Otherwise the space is custom.

summary.para: Creates a Direct2D effect for the specified class ID. This is the same as so custom effects can create other effects and wrap them in a transform.

param.name: effectId
param.para: The built-in or registered effect ID to create the effect. See Built-in Effects for a list of effect IDs.

param.name: effect
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the effect.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid value was passed to the method.
Direct3D does not have enough display memory to perform the operation.
The specified effect is not registered by the system.

remarks.para: The created effect does not reference count the DLL from which the effect was created. If the caller unregisters an effect while this effect is loaded, the resulting behavior is unpredictable.

summary.para: Creates and returns an offset transform.

param.name: transform
param.para: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to an offset transform object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

remarks.para: An offset transform is used to offset an input bitmap without having to insert a rendering pass. An offset transform is automatically inserted by an Affine transform if the transform evaluates to a pixel-aligned transform.

summary.para: Creates or finds the given resource texture, depending on whether a resource id is specified. It also optionally initializes the texture with the specified data.

param.name: resourceId
param.para: An optional pointer to the unique id that identifies the lookup table.

param.name: resourceTextureProperties
param.para: The properties used to create the resource texture.

param.name: data
param.para: The optional data to be loaded into the resource texture.

param.name: strides
param.para: An optional pointer to the stride to advance through the resource texture, according to dimension.

param.name: dataSize
param.para: The size, in bytes, of the data.

param.name: resourceTexture
param.para: The returned texture that can be used as a resource in a Direct2D effect.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

summary.para: Wraps an effect graph into a single transform node and then inserted into a transform graph. This allows an effect to aggregate other effects. This will typically be done in order to allow the effect properties to be re-expressed with a different contract, or to allow different components to integrate each-other’s effects.

param.name: effect
param.para: The effect to be wrapped in a transform node.

param.name: transformNode
param.para: The returned transform node that encapsulates the effect graph.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

summary.para: Creates a vertex buffer or finds a standard vertex buffer and optionally initializes it with vertices. The returned buffer can be specified in the render info to specify both a vertex shader and or to pass custom vertices to the standard vertex shader used by Direct2D.

param.name: vertexBufferProperties
param.para: The properties used to describe the vertex buffer and vertex shader.

param.name: resourceId
param.para: The unique id that identifies the vertex buffer.

param.name: customVertexBufferProperties
param.para: The properties used to define a custom vertex buffer. If you use a built-in vertex shader, you don't have to specify this property.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

summary.para: Finds the given resource texture if it has already been created with with the same GUID.

param.name: resourceId
param.para: The unique id that identifies the resource texture.

param.name: resourceTexture
param.para: The returned texture that can be used as a resource in a Direct2D effect.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: The requested resource texture was not found.

summary.para: This finds the given vertex buffer if it has already been created with with the same GUID.

param.name: resourceId
param.para: The unique id that identifies the vertex buffer.

param.name: buffer
param.para: The returned vertex buffer that can be used as a resource in a Direct2D effect.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: The requested vertex buffer was not found.

summary.para: Gets the unit mapping that an effect will use for properties that could be in either dots per inch (dpi) or pixels.

remarks.para: If the is D2D1_UNIT_MODE_PIXELS, both dpiX and dpiY will be set to 96.

summary.para: This indicates the maximum feature level from the provided list which is supported by the device. If none of the provided levels are supported, then this API fails with D2DERR_INSUFFICIENT_DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.

param.name: featureLevels
param.para: The feature levels provided by the application.

param.name: featureLevelsCount
param.para: The count of feature levels provided by the application

param.name: maximumSupportedFeatureLevel
param.para: The maximum feature level from the featureLevels list which is supported by the D2D device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.
None of the provided levels are supported.

summary.para: Indicates whether the buffer precision is supported by the underlying Direct2D

returns.para: Returns TRUE if the buffer precision is supported. Returns FALSE if the buffer precision is not supported.

summary.para: This tests to see if the given shader is loaded.

param.name: shaderId
param.para: The unique id that identifies the shader.

summary.para: Loads the given shader by its unique ID. Loading the shader multiple times is ignored. When the shader is loaded it is also handed to the driver to JIT, if it hasn’t been already.

param.name: resourceId
param.para: The unique id that identifies the shader.

param.name: shaderBuffer
param.para: The buffer that contains the shader to register.

param.name: shaderBufferCount
param.para: The size of the shader buffer in bytes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

item.description: Direct2D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

remarks.para: The shader you specify must be compiled, not in raw HLSL code.

summary.para: Provides factory methods and other state management for effect and transform authors.

remarks.para: This interface is passed to an effect implementation through the method. In order to prevent applications casually gaining access to this interface, and to separate reference counts between the public and private interfaces, it is not possible to call between the and the ID2D1EffectContext.

Each call to will be provided a different ID2D1EffectContext interface. This interface tracks resource allocations for the effect. When the effect is released, the corresponding allocations will also be released.
